definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident

sentences.english: Communities as well as individuals suffer.
sentences.chinese: 如同個體一樣，團體也會遭難。

sentences.english: On that fateful day Faida was on the same road she always took after working in the peanut fields.
sentences.chinese: 在其遭難的那天，菲達一如往常地走在同一條路上。

sentences.english: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
sentences.chinese: 我見古珊的帳棚遭難，米甸的幔子戰兢。

sentences.english: He remembered us in our humiliation, his kindness endures forever.
sentences.chinese: 他懷念了我們遭難的人，因爲他的仁慈永遠常存。

sentences.english: The attack on Pearl Harbor am a crushing calamity.
sentences.chinese: 偷襲珍珠港是一次具有毀滅性的遭難。

sentences.english: The cars blocking the exits could turn this place into a death-trap.
sentences.chinese: 那些汽車堵住出口能把這地方變成遭難場所。

sentences.english: Slander is the external cause for Qingwens mis fortune.
sentences.chinese: 晴雯遭難，“誹謗”起了極壞的作用，這是外因。

definition: to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
